skin.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the natural outer layer of a person’s or animal’s body
skin.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She had thick black hair and smooth dark skin.
The skin on his hands was dry and rough.
skin.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the skin of an animal, sometimes including its fur, used to make leather, clothes etc
skin.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the natural outer cover of some fruits and vegetables
skin.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the outer cover of a sausage
skin.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a thin solid layer that forms on the top of a liquid, especially when it gets cold
skin.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Cover the soup to stop a skin from forming.
skin.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a layer that is part of a vehicle, building, object etc, especially on the outside
skin.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The outer skin of the aircraft was not punctured.
The lampshade has a double skin so that it remains cool.
skin.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: the way particular information appears on a computer screen, especially when this can be changed quickly and easily
skin.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I have fair skin that burns very easily.
a girl with beautiful dark skin
a boy with dark eyes and olive skin
Her skin was smooth and pale.
Vitamin E helps keep your skin healthy.
I had terrible skin when I was a teenager.
My skin’s really bad at the moment.
The girls all had perfect features and flawless skin.
A lot of women suffer from dry skin.
My skin has a tendency to be oily.
Special shampoos are available for those with sensitive skin.
The cream made my skin feel itchy.
The skin on his hands was rough and dry.
a lean man with leathery skin and sea-blue eyes
an old lady with wrinkled skin
The crocodile’s scaly skin is ideally suited to its way of life.
Strong sunlight can damage your skin.
It's important to use suntan lotion to protect your skin.
Some types of make-up can irritate your skin.
The lotion helps to soothe your skin after you've been in the sun all day.
beauty products that will make your skin glow
The week after the holiday my skin was already starting to peel.
The skin on her arms was already starting to sag.
There is still discrimination on the basis of skin colour.
Do the colours of your clothes enhance your skin tone?
She suffers from a nasty skin condition.
A lot of chemicals can cause skin irritation.
Skin rashes are common among children.
Too much exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
skin.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to remove the skin from an animal, fruit, or vegetable
skin.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Add the tomatoes, skinned and sliced.
skin.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to hurt yourself by rubbing off some skin
skin.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: She fell and skinned her knee.
skin.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The football team really skinned Watertown last year.
